item.title: Python Applications in Biology: FASTA
item.description: Using a RegEx Function to Count the # of Sequences in a FASTA File FASTA is a text-based format for representing nucleotide or amino acid sequences using single-letter code: Adenine = A, Thymine = T, C = Cytosine. A popular, free tool for comparing FASTA sequences is NIH's BLAST: https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi BLAST's algorithm is written in C and C++, but regular expressions in Python can perform a lot of the same functions as BLAST such as counting k-mers, calculating sequence alignment, etc.

item.title: R and Python Communication with Reticulate
item.description: R and Python Communication Using the 'Reticulate' Package Creating an object in R: #install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) xmas <- "Eat all the Christmas" Accessing the object with Python: cookie = "cookies" print(r.xmas,cookie) ## Eat all the Christmas cookies Here you go!
